description: Count
name: Count

description: Milligram per Kilogram (mg/kg)
name: Milligram per Kilogram (mg/kg)

description: Grams Per Cubic Centimetre
name: Grams Per Cubic Centimetre

description: A unit of pressure equal to 9.80665*10-05 Bar
name: Kilogram per square metre

description: Cubic foot per minute
name: Cubic Foot Per Minute

description: The number of centimetre per second the trade item or part of the trade item moves.
name: Centimetre Per Second

description: A measurement for sound in air and other gases, relative to 20 micropascals (μPa) = 2×10−5 Pa, the quietest sound a human can hear. This is roughly the sound of a mosquito flying 3 metres away. This is often abbreviated to just "dB"; however the correct abbreviation is dB(SPL), indicating decibel for Sound Pressure Level.
name: Decibel

description: A unit of information equal to 10³ (1000) bytes.
name: Kilobyte

description: kBq is 10³ Bq
name: Kilo Becquerel

description: Metre Per Minute
name: Metre Per Minute

description: A microlitre is one millionth of a litre
name: Microlitre

description: A micrometre is one millionth of a metre, also termed Micron.
name: Micrometre

description: A unit of information equal to 10  (1000000) bytes.
name: Megabyte

description: Megabecquerel: 106 Bq1 Bq is defined as the activity of a quantity of radioactive material in which one nucleus decays per second.
name: Megabecquerel

description: A unit of mass defining the total number of kilograms after deductions.
name: Net kilogram

description: A unit of proportion equal to 10-6 (ppm).
name: Part per million

description: A unit of count defining the number of batches (batch: quantity of material produced in one operation or number of animals or persons coming at once).
name: Batch

description:
Psig (pound-force per square inch gauge) is a unit of pressure relative to the surrounding atmosphere. At sea level, Earth's atmosphere actually exerts a pressure of 14.7 psi. Humans do not feel this pressure because internal pressure of liquid in their bodies matches the external pressure. If a pressure gauge is calibrated to read zero in space, then at sea level on Earth it would read 14.7 psi. Thus a reading of 30 psig, on Earth, on a tire gauge represents an absolute pressure of 44.7 psi 
(lb/in²).
name: Pound per square inch - Gauge

description: Psia (pound-force per square inch absolute)is a unit of pressure pressure relative to a vacuum (such as that in space). At sea level, Earth's atmosphere actually exerts a pressure of 14.7 psi. Humans do not feel this pressure because internal pressure of liquid in their bodies matches the external pressure. If a pressure gauge is calibrated to read zero in space, then at sea level on Earth it would read 14.7 psi. Thus a reading of 30 psig, on Earth, on a tire gauge represents an absolute pressure of 44.7 psi (lb/in²).
name: Pound per square inch - Absolute

description: A unit of length equal to one hundred-millionth of a centimetre, 10–10 metre, used mainly to express wavelengths and interatomic distances.
name: Angstrom

description: Candela per Square Metre
name: Candela per Square Metre

description: A unit of mass defining the difference between the weight of a ship when completely empty and its weight when completely loaded, expressed as the number of tons.
name: Deadweight Tonnage

description: Femtometre- a quadrillionth of a metre (10 to the negative 15th power)
name: Femtometre

description: A unit of frenquecy equal to 109 Hertz
name: Gigahertz

description: A unit of information equal to 8 bits.
name: Byte

description: A unit of electric charge defining the amount of charge accumulated by a steady flow of one ampere for one hour.
name: Ampere Hour

description: Ampere
name: Ampere

description: Unit of time equal to 365,25 days.
name: Year

description: The troy ounce is a unit of imperial measure. In the present day it is most commonly used to gauge the weight and therefore the price of precious metals.  One troy ounce equals 480 grains or 31.1035 grams.
name: Troy ounce or apothecary ounce

description: A unit of count defining the number of assortments (assortment: set of items grouped in a mixed collection).
name: Assortment

description: Standard Atmosphere
name: Standard Atmosphere

description: Technical Atmosphere
name: Technical Atmosphere

description: Gauge- A number referring to the outer diameter of hypodermic or suture needles. Smaller gauge numbers indicate larger outer diameters. Inner diameter depends on both gauge and wall thickness. An increasing needle-gauge size corresponds to a smaller diameter needle. This is contrary to French Gauge where an increasing gauge size corresponds to a larger external diameter.
name: Gauge

description: A unit of measure for blood potency. Units for the anti XA activity which is a measure to the anti coagulating effect at low molecular heparins.
name: Anti XA Unit

description:
In telecommunications and computing, bitrate (sometimes written bit rate, data rate or as a variable R or fb) is the number of bits that are conveyed or processed per unit of time. 
 
The bit rate is quantified using the bits per second (bit/s or bps) unit.
name: Bit per second

description: The gravitational force of a kilogram weight or a one-kilogram mass multiplied by the acceleration of standard Earth gravity, equal to 9.8 newtons.
name: Kilogram Force

description: 1000 Newtons or amount needed to accelerate 1 kilogram of mass at the rate of 1 metre per second squared multiplied by 1000 (Used to measure force of an object where the value exceeds 1000 newtons).
name: Kilonewton

description: Lumens per Square Meter
name: Lumens per Square Meter

description: The number of Lumens expressed per watt.
name: Lumens Per Watt

description:
Lumen seconds is the SI derived unit of luminous energy. It is based on the lumen, the SI unit of luminous flux, and the second, the SI base unit of time.
The lumen second is sometimes called the Talbot (symbol T).
name: Lumen Seconds

description: Exposure is measured in lux seconds, and can be computed from exposure value (EV) and scene luminance in a specified region.
name: Lux Seconds

description: The bar is widely used in descriptions of pressure; 1 bar = 100 kilopascals 0.987 atmospheres.
name: Bar (unit of pressure)

description: A unit of area of 112 sheets of tin mil products (tin plate, tin free steel or black plate) 14 by 20 inches, or 31,360 square inches.
name: Base box

description: A specialized unit of measure for the volume of rough lumber (before drying and planing with no adjustments) or planed/surfaced lumber. It is the volume of a one-foot length of a board one foot wide and one inch thick. Some countries utilize the synonym super foot or superficial foot.
name: Board Foot

description: There are varying standards for barrel for some specific commodities, including 31 gal for beer, 40 gal for whiskey or kerosene, and 42 gal for petroleum. The general standard for liquids is 31.5 gal or half a hogshead; the general standard for dry contents is 7,056 Cubic Inches.
name: Barrel US

description: A unit of volume equal to one hundred board foot.
name: Hundred board foot

description: Beats Per Minute
name: Beats Per Minute

description: The becquerel (symbol Bq) is the SI derived unit of radioactivity. One Bq is defined as the activity of a quantity of radioactive material in which one nucleus decays per second. SI uses the becquerel rather than the second for the unit of activity measure to avoid dangerous mistakes: a measurement in becquerels is proportional to activity, and thus a more dangerous source of radiation gives a higher reading. A measurement in seconds is inversely proportional.
name: Becquerel

description: The British thermal unit (BTU or Btu) is a traditional unit of energy. It is approximately the amount of energy needed to heat one pound of water one degree Fahrenheit. One Btu is equal to about 1.06 kilojoules. It is used in the power, steam generation, heating and air conditioning industries.
name: British thermal unit

description: A bushel is an imperial and U.S. customary unit of dry volume, equivalent in each of these systems to 4 pecks or 8 gallons. It is used for volumes of dry commodities (not liquids), most often in agriculture
name: Bushel (US)

description: A bushel is an imperial and U.S. customary unit of dry volume, equivalent in each of these systems to 4 pecks or 8 gallons. It is used for volumes of dry commodities (not liquids), most often in agriculture
name: Bushel (UK)

description: The number of millimetre per second the trade item or part of the trade item moves.
name: Millimetre Per Second

description: a millimole is one thousandth of a mole.
name: Millimole

description:
A millisecond (from milli- and second; abbreviation: 
ms) is a thousandth (1/1000) of a second.
name: Millisecond

description: The mole (symbol mol) is the SI base unit of amount of substance; one of a few units used to measure this physical quantity. A mole will possess mass exactly equal to the substance's molecular or atomic weight in grams. That is to say, a substance's atomic or molecular mass in atomic mass units is the same as its molar mass in grams. Because of this, one can measure the number of moles in a pure substance by weighing it and comparing the result to its molecular or atomic weight
name: Mole

description: Nanometre- a billionth of a metre (10 to the negative 9th power)
name: Nanometre

description: A nanosecond is an SI unit of time equal to one thousand-millionth of a second (or one billionth of a second), that is, 10−9 seconds.
name: Nano Seconds

description: Picometre- a trillionth of a metre (10 to the negative 12th power)
name: Picometre

description: Pascal second ( N s / m 2 ) is the unit of dynamic viscosity which is also known as the absolute viscosity of the fluid. It is the fluids internal resistance to flow . e.g.: water has dynamic viscosity of 1.787 at 273K or 0 degrees Celsius. and 1.002 Pa-second at 293K i.e. 20degrees Celsius.
name: Pascal Seconds

description: Picowatt is a derived metric SI (System International) measurement unit of power.  The picowatt is equal to one trillionth of a watt (10-12W).
name: Picowatt

description: Celsius (also historically known as centigrade) is a temperature scale, the freezing point of water is 0 degrees Celsius (°C) and the boiling point 100 °C (at standard atmospheric pressure), placing the boiling and freezing points of water exactly 100 degrees apart.
name: Degree Celsius

description: Colony Forming Units: is a rough estimate of the number of viable bacteria or fungal cells in a sample.
name: Colony Forming Units

description: A unit of count defining the number of units of card (card: thick stiff paper or cardboard).
name: Card

description: A centigram is one hundredth (1/100) of a gram
name: Centigram

description: A centilitre is one hundredth (1/100) of a litre
name: Centilitre

description: A square centimetre is an area of a square whose sides are exactly 1 centimetre in length.
name: Square centimetre

description: A cubic centimetre is the volume of a cube of side length one centimetre (0.01 m) equal to a millilitre.
name: Cubic centimetre

description: A centimetre is  equal to one hundredth of a metre.
name: Centimetre

description: Metric Carat.
name: Metric Carat

description: A unit of weight in the U.S. Customary System equal to 100 pounds (45.36 kilograms); also called cental.
name: Hundred pound (cwt) / hundred weight (US)

description: A unit of weight in the British Imperial System equal to 112 pounds (50.80 kilograms); also called quintal.
name: Hundred weight (UK)

description: A unit of accumulated energy of a thousand watts over a period of one hour.
name: Kilowatt / hour

description: Square metre kelvin per watt .The definition is the thermal resistance (or Rd value) of the material, which is measured by the thickness of the material layer divided by the thermal conductivity of the material. and is expressed in m²K/W.
name: Square Metre Kelvin Per Watt

description: A unit of frenquecy equal to 1012 Hertz
name: Terahertz

description: A terajoule is 10¹² joules
name: Terajoule

description: A terawatt hour is 109 * kilowat hour or 3.6 petajoules.
name: Terawatt hour

description: References SI system of units of measure
name: Thousand Litre

description: Atomic Mass Units
name: Atomic Mass Units (AMU)

description:
A kilogram-force per square centimeter (kgf/cm2), often just kilogram per square centimeter (kg/cm2), or kilopond per square centimeter is a unit of pressure using metric units. Its use is now deprecated; it is not a part of the International 
System of Units (SI), the modern metric system. 
The unit is similar to the English unit psi (lbf/in2).
name: Kilogram per square centimetre

description: Heat Transfer Coefficient
name: Heat Transfer Coefficient

description: A unit of count defining the number of books (book: set of items bound together or written document of a material whole).
name: Book

description: A calorie is 1/100 of the amount of energy required to warm one gram of air-free water from 0 °C to 100 °C at standard atmospheric pressure; this is about 4.190 J.  Its use is archaic, having been replaced by the SI unit of energy, the joule. However, in many countries it remains in common use as a unit of food energy. In the context of nutrition, and especially food labelling, the calorie is approximately equal to 4.1868 joules (J), and energy values are normally quoted in kilojoules (kJ) and kilocalories (kcal).
name: Calorie - International Table (IT)

description: A day is one three hundreds and sixty fifth (1/365) of a year
name: Days

description: A measurement of plane angle, representing 1⁄360 of a full rotation; one degree is equivalent to π/180 radians.
name: Degree (Unit of Angle)

description: A decigram is one tenth (1/10) of a gram.
name: Decigram

description: A decilitre is one tenth (1/10) of a litre.
name: Decilitre

description: A square deciimetre is an area of a square whose sides are exactly 1 deciimetre in length.
name: Square decimetre

description: A cubic decimetre is the volume of a cube of side length one decimetre (0.1 m)
name: Cubic decimetre

description: A decimetre is  equal to one tenth of a metre.
name: Decimetre

description: The dram (archaic spelling drachm) was historically both a coin and a weight. Currently it is both a small mass in the Apothecaries' system of weights and a small unit of volume. This unit is called more correctly fluid dram or in contraction also fluidram. The term also refers to the fluid dram, a measure of capacity equal 1⁄8 of a fluid ounce, which means it is exactly equal to 3.696 691 195 312 5 mL in the United States.
name: Dram (US)

description: The dram (archaic spelling drachm) was historically both a coin and a weight. Currently it is both a small mass in the Apothecaries' system of weights and a small unit of volume. This unit is called more correctly fluid dram or in contraction also fluidram. The fluid dram is defined as 1⁄8 of a fluid ounce, which means it is exactly equal to 3.551 632 812 500 0 mL in the Commonwealth and Ireland. In England dram came to mean a small draught of cordial or alcohol; hence the term dram-house for the taverns where one could purchase a dram.
name: Dram (UK)

description: A unit of count defining the number of units in multiples of 12.
name: Dozen

description: Milliampere hour
name: Milliampere hour

description: A unit of energy equal to 1000 calories.
name: Kilocalorie

description: A unit of information equal to 10⁶ (1000000) bits (binary digits) per second.
name: 10⁶ (1000000) bits (binary digits) per second

description:
A unit of count defining the number of doses (dose: 
a definite quantity of a medicine or drug).
name: Dose

description: Litre Per Hour
name: Litre Per Hour

description: A unit of information equal to 109 bytes.
name: Gigabyte

description: A unit of information equal to 10¹² bytes.
name: Terabyte

description: A unit of information equal to 10¹5 bytes. 1000 Terabytes = 1 Petabyte
name: Petabyte

description:
A unit of count defining the number of pixels (pixel: 
picture element).
name: Pixel

description: A unit of count defining the number of dots per linear inch as a measure of the resolution or sharpness of a graphic image.
name: Dots per inch

description: A unit of mass defining the total number of kilograms before deductions.
name: Gross kilogram

description: A unit of count defining the number of times an object is used.
name: Use

description: A unit of count defining the number of items regarded as separate units.
name: Each

description: Enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay unit, is always associated with a product and a method.
name: ELISA Units

description: Gram Per Hour
name: Gram Per Hour

description: Inch of mercury conversion of  3,386 39 × 10³ kg x m⁻¹ x s⁻² OR 3386.389 pascals.
name: Inch of Mercury

description: The Fahrenheit temperature scale, the freezing point of water is 32 degrees Fahrenheit (°F) and the boiling point 212 °F (at standard atmospheric pressure), placing the boiling and freezing points of water exactly 180 degrees apart.
name: Degree Fahrenheit

description: One millionth (10 -6 ) of a mole.
name: Micromole

description: Sizing Factor
name: Sizing Factor

description: The international foot is defined to be equal to 0.3048 meters.
name: Foot

description: A non SI unit of Pressure approximately equal to 47.88025 PASCAL's.
name: Pound per square foot

description: The number of foot per minute the trade item or part of the trade item moves.
name: Foot Per Minute

description: The number of foot per second the trade item or part of the trade item moves.
name: Foot Per Second

description: A square foot is an area of a square whose sides are exactly 1 foot in length.
name: Square foot

description: A cubic foot is the volume of a cube of side length one foot (0.3048 m) .
name: Cubic foot

description: US gallon per minute
name: US Gallon Per Minute

description: Cup (US)
name: Cup (US)

description: A peck is an imperial and U.S. customary unit of dry volume, equivalent in each of these systems to 2 gallons, 8 dry quarts, or 16 dry pints.
name: Peck

description: Tablespoon. 1/2 fluid ounces, 3 teaspoons, 15 millilitres
name: Tablespoon

description: Teaspoon. 1/6 fluid ounces or  5 millilitres
name: Teaspoon

description: The stere or stère is a unit of volume in the original metric system equal to one cubic metre. The stère is typically used for measuring large quantities of firewood or other cut wood,
name: Stere

description: A unit of activity equal to 109 becquerels.
name: Gigabecquerel

description: A unit of mass defining the number of grams of a fissile isotope (fissile isotope: an isotope whose nucleus is able to be split when irradiated with low energy neutrons).
name: Gram of Fissile Isotope

description: A unit of measurement of mass concentration that shows how many grams of a certain substance are present in one litre.
name: Gram Per Litre

description: The imperial (UK) gallon was legally defined as 4.54609 litres.
name: Gallon (UK)

description: The U.S. liquid gallon is legally defined as 231 cubic inches, and is equal to exactly 3.785411784 litres or about 0.133680555 cubic feet.
name: Gallon (US)

description:
In the metric system, the density of all types of paper, paperboard, and fabric, is expressed in terms of grams per square meter (g/m²).  
This quantity is commonly called grammage both in 
English and French (ISO 536), though many English-speaking countries still refer to the "weight". 
The term density here is used somewhat incorrectly, as density is mass by volume. More precisely, it is a measure of the area density, areal density, or surface density.
name: Gram per square metre

description: A gram is defined as one one-thousandth of the kilogram (1×10-3 kg).
name: Gram

description: A grain or troy grain is precisely 64.79891 milligrams. Exactly 7,000 grains per avoirdupois pound.
name: Grain

description: A unit of count defining the number of units in multiples of 144 (12 x 12).
name: Gross

description: A gigaawatt hour is 109 kilowat hour or 3.6 terajoules.
name: Gigawatt hour

description: The number of centimetre per hour the trade item or part of the trade item moves.
name: Centimetre Per Hour

description: The number of millimetre per hour the trade item or part of the trade item moves.
name: Millimetre Per Hour

description: The French scale (most correctly abbreviated as Fr, but also often abbreviated as FR or F) is commonly used to measure the catheter size (Circumference is in millimeters), in which 1 Fr = 0.33 mm in diameter. In the French Gauge system as it is also known, the diameter in millimeters of the catheter can be determined by dividing the French size by 3, thus an increasing French size corresponds with a larger diameter catheter. The following equations summarize the relationships: D(mm) = Fr/3 or Fr = D(mm)*3
name: French gauge

description: The number of millimetre per minute the trade item or part of the trade item moves.
name: Millimetre Per Minute

description: Litre per kilogram.
name: Litre per kilogram

description: A unit of count defining the number of pieces (piece: a single item, article or exemplar).
name: Piece

description: A unit of count defining the number of units counted in multiples of 100.
name: Hundred count

description: A unit of count defining the number of units in multiplt of six (6).
name: Half dozen

description: Histamine equivalent prick testing for allergen.
name: Histamine Equivalent Prick

description: A hectogram is one hundred (100) grams
name: Hectogram

description: A hectolitre is one hundred (100) litres.
name: Hectolitre

description: The number of mile per hour the trade item or part of the trade item moves.
name: Mile Per Hour (statute mile)

description: Conventional millimetre of mercury mm Hg.
name: Conventional millimetre of mercury

description: A unit of frequency defined as the number of complete cycles per second; it is the basic unit of frequency in the International System of Units (SI).
name: Hertz

description: An hour is a unit of measurement of time of the duration of 60 minutes, or 3600 seconds. It is 1/24 of a median Earth day.
name: Hour

description: An international inch is defined to be equal to 25.4 millimeters.
name: Inches

description: A square inch is an area of a square whose sides are exactly 1 inch in length.
name: Square inch

description: A cubic inch is the volume of a cube of side length one inch (0.254 m).
name: Cubic inch

description: The number of inch per second the trade item or part of the trade item moves.
name: Inch Per Second

description: A joule is the energy exerted by a force of one newton acting to move an object through a distance of one metre.
name: Joule

description: The number of foot per hour the trade item or part of the trade item moves.
name: Foot Per Hour

description: Gallon (US liquid) per second
name: Gallon (US liquid) Per Second

description: Horsepower (electric) -  Automotive horsepower is defined as "a unit of power equal to 550 foot-pounds per second (745.7 watts)".
name: Horsepower

description: A kilolitre is one thousand (1000) litres.
name: Kilolitre

description: Kilogram drained net weight.
name: Kilogram drained net weight

description: A unit of mass equal to one thousand grams.
name: Kilogram

description: Kilogram of hydrogen peroxide.
name: Kilogram of hydrogen peroxide

description: A unit of frenquecy equal to 103 Hertz
name: Kilohertz

description: Kallikrein Inactivator Unit per Milliliter definition: An arbitrary unit of a kallikrein inactivator concentration equal to the concentration at which one milliliter of the mixture contains one unit of the kallikrein inactivator
name: Kallikrein inactivator unit.

description: A kilojoule is 1000 joules
name: Kilojoule

description: Kilogram of methylamine
name: Kilogram of methylamine

description: The number of kilometre per hour the trade item or part of the trade item moves.
name: Kilometre Per Hour

description: A kilometre is one thousand (1000) metres
name: Kilometre

description: Kilogram of nitrogen
name: Kilogram of nitrogen

description: Kilonewton Per Square Metre
name: Kilonewton Per Square Metre

description: The number of knots the trade item or part of the trade item moves. A Knot is a unit of speed equal to one nautical mile (1.852 km) per hour, approximately 1.151 mph.
name: Knot

description:
The milliequivalence caustic potash per gram of product. A unit of count defining the number of milligrams of potassium hydroxide per gram of 
product as a measure of the concentration of potassium hydroxide in the product.
name: The milliequivalence caustic potash per gram of product

description: Kilopascal- a thousand pascals (10 to the 3rd power)
name: Kilopascal- a thousand pascals (10 to the 3rd power)

description: Kilogram of potassium hydroxide (caustic potash)
name: Kilogram of potassium hydroxide (caustic potash)

description: Kilogram of potassium oxide
name: Kilogram of potassium oxide

description: Kilogram of phosphorus pentoxide (phosphoric anhydride).
name: Kilogram of phosphorus pentoxide (phosphoric anhydride)

description: Kilogram of substance 90% dry
name: Kilogram of substance 90% dry

description: Kilogram of sodium hydroxide (caustic soda)
name: Kilogram of sodium hydroxide (caustic soda)

description: A unit of count defining the number of kits (kit: tub, barrel or pail).
name: Kit

description: A unit of mass equal to one thousand grams of uranium.
name: Kilogram of Uranium

description:
A kilowatt hour is a unit of energy equal to 3.6 megajoules. 
It is also a common commercial unit of electric energy representing the amount of energy delivered at a rate of 1,000 watts over a period of one hour.
name: Kilowatt hour

description: A kilowatt is one thousand (1000) watts
name: Kilowatt

description: The international avoirdupois pound of exactly 0.45359237 kilogram.
name: Pound

description: Litre per day.
name: Litre / Day

description: A unit of count defining the number of feet (12inch) in length of a uniform width object.
name: Linear foot

description: A unit of distance equal to 0.01 chain.
name: Link

description: A unit of count defining the number of metres in length of a uniform width object.
name: Linear metre

description: Litre of pure alcohol.
name: Litre of pure alcohole

description: A unit of count defining the number of layers.
name: Layer

description: Ton (UK) = 1016 Kg or 2240 Lb.
name: Ton (UK) or long ton (US)

description: A litre is defined as a special name for a cubic decimetre (1 L = 1 dm3 = 103 cm3).
name: Litre

description: The International System unit of illumination, equal to one lumen per square meter.
name: Lux

description: The number of mile per minute the trade item or part of the trade item moves.
name: Mile Per Minute

description: The number of mile per second the trade item or part of the trade item moves.
name: Mile Per Second

description: The number of meter per hour the trade item or part of the trade item moves.
name: Metre Per Hour

description: The number of kilometre per second the trade item or part of the trade item moves.
name: Kilometre Per Second

description: The number of inch per minute the trade item or part of the trade item moves.
name: Inch Per Minute

description: The number of yard per second the trade item or part of the trade item moves.
name: Yard Per Second

description: The number of yard per minute the trade item or part of the trade item moves.
name: Yard Per Minute

description: The number of yard per hour the trade item or part of the trade item moves.
name: Yard Per Hour

description: A unit of power defining the rate of energy transferred or consumed when a current of 1000 amperes flows due to a potential of 1000 volts at unity power factor.
name: Megawatt

description: Millibar- a hundred pascals (10 to the 2nd power)
name: Millibar

description: A microgram is one millionth of a gram (0.000001)
name: Microgram

description: mEq or milliequivalents, the measure is used in terms of milliequivalents of solute per liter of solvent (or milliNormal  where mEq/L = mN). This is especially common for measurement of compounds in biological fluids; for instance, the healthy level of potassium in the blood of a human is defined between 3.5 and 5.0 mEq/L. To better be able to denote the units of measure for nutrients as used in business today.
name: Milliequivalents

description: A milligram is one thousandth of a gram (0.001)
name: Milligram

description: A unit of frenquecy equal to 106 Hertz
name: Megahertz

description: A square mile is an area of a square whose sides are exactly 1 mile in length.
name: Square mile

description: A minute is a unit of time equal to 1/60th of an hour or 60 seconds
name: Minute (unit of time)

description: A unit of count defining the number of international units in multiples of 106.
name: Million International Unit (NIE)

description: A millilitre is one thousandth of a litre (0.001)
name: Millilitre

description: A square millimetre is an area of a square whose sides are exactly 1 millimetre in length.
name: Square millimetre

description: A cubic millimetre is the volume of a cube of side length one milliimetre (0.001 m)
name: Cubic millimetre

description: A millimetre is one thousandth of a metre (0.001)
name: Millimetre

description: Unit of time equal to 1/12 of a year of 365,25 days
name: Month

description: Most Probable Number: is a method of getting quantitative data on concentrations of discrete items from positive/negative (incidence) data..
name: Most Probable Number

description: Cubic Metre Per Hour
name: Cubic Metre Per Hour

description: A square metre is an area of a square whose sides are exactly 1 metre in length.
name: Square metre

description: A cubic metre is the volume of a cube of side length one metre.
name: Cubic metre

description: The metre is the basic unit of length in the International System of Units (SI).
name: Metre

description: Defines the speed defined by distance in metres divided by time in seconds.
name: Metre Per Second

description: A unit of energy defining the total amount of bulk energy transferred or consumed.
name: Megawatt hour (1000 kW.h)

description: Non SI-conforming unit of pressure according to the Anglo-American and Imperial system for units, whereas the value of 1 inHg meets the static pressure, which is generated by a mercury at a temperature of 32°F with a height of 1 inch.3,386 38 x 10³ Pa OR 3386.38 pascals.
name: Inch of Mercury (32 ºF)

description: Non SI-conforming unit of pressure according to the Anglo-American and Imperial system for units, whereas the value of 1 inHg meets the static pressure, which is generated by a mercury at a temperature of 60°F with a height of 1 inch.3,376 85 x 10³ Pa OR 3376.85 pascals.
name: Inch of Mercury (60 ºF)

description: Number of cells
name: Number of cells

description: Newton
name: Newton

description:
A unit of count defining the number of international units. 
The International Unit is a unit of measurement for the amount of a substance, based on measured biological activity or effect. 
The unit is used for vitamins, hormones, some medications, vaccines, blood products, and similar biologically active substances
name: Number of International Units

description: Number of pairs
name: Number of pairs

description: Newton Metre
name: Newton Metre

description: A unit for electrical impedance, the ratio of the voltage phasor to the electric current phasor.
name: Ohm

description:
The weight of one square yard of the material expressed in ounces.   
Commonly used to express the density or weight of all types of paper, paperboard, and fabric, e.g. 20 OZ or 20 Weight denim has an area density of 20 oz/yd2. 
The term density here is used somewhat incorrectly, as density is mass by volume. More precisely, it is a measure of the area density, areal density, or surface density.
name: Ounces per square yard

description:
A unit of mass with several definitions, the most 
commonly used of which are equal to approximately 30 grams
name: Ounce

description: Oscillations Per Minute
name: Oscillations Per Minute

description: A fluid ounce (US) is equal to one sixteenth (1/16) of a US pint or   29.5735295625 millilitres .
name: Fluid ounce (US)

description: A fluid ounce (UK) is equal to one thirtieth (1/30) of a UK pint or 28.4130625 millilitres.
name: Fluid ounce (UK)

description: A unit of proportion equal to 0.01.
name: Percent

description: The pascal (symbol: Pa) is the SI derived unit of pressure, stress, Young's modulus and tensile strength. It is a measure of force per unit area, defined as one newton per square metre.
name: Pascal

description: A unit of count defining the number of pads (pad: block of paper sheets fastened together at one end).
name: Pad

description: Plaque Forming unit(s)
name: Plaque Forming unit(s)

description: A single unit on a scale of measurement as part of an incentive program or pricing structure used as a means of making a quantitative evaluation.
name: Point

description:
A unit of count defining the number of pairs (pair: 
item described by two's).
name: Pair

description: Potential Renal Solute Load
name: Potential Renal Solute Load

description:
The pound-force per square inch (symbol: psi or lbf/in2 or lbf/in2) is a unit of pressure or of stress based on avoirdupois units. It is the pressure resulting from a force of one pound-force applied to an area of one square inch. 
Other abbreviations are used that append a modifier to "psi". However, the US National Institute of Standards and Technology recommends that, to avoid confusion, any modifiers be instead applied to the quantity being measured rather than the unit of measure[1] For example, "Pg = 100 psi" rather than "P = 100 psig".
name: Pound-force per square inch

description: The United States dry pint is equal one eighth of a US dry gallon or one half US dry quarts. It is used in the United States but is not as common as the liquid pint.
name: Dry Pint (US)

description: A pint (UK) is equal to 1/8 Gallon (UK); used primarly as a measure for beer and cider when sold by the glass.
name: Pint (UK)

description: The US liquid pint is equal one eighth of a United States liquid gallon.
name: Liquid pint (US)

description: Portion
name: Portion:

description: The activity of the (solvated) hydrogen ion (a logarithmic measure used to state the acidity or alkalinity of a chemical solution).
name: pH (potential of Hydrogen)

description: Femtolitre- Femtolitre is the metric unit of volume equal to one thousand trillionth (European) or one quadrillionth (American) litre. One femtolitre is the same as one cubic micrometre (μm3), , which can be represented numerically as 0.00000000000001/liter.
name: Femtolitre

description:
Picoliter is the metric unit of volume equal to a 
trillionth (one millionth of a millionth) of a liter, which can be represented numerically as 0.000000000001/liter. just as the prefix nano denotes a billionth part
name: Picolitre

description: Nanolitre is the metric unit of volume equal to one billionth of a litre, which can be represented numerically as 0.000000001/liter.
name: Nanolitre

description: A unit of count defining the number of hardcopy pages (hardcopy page: a page rendered as printed or written output on paper, film, or other permanent medium).
name: Page - hardcopy

description: A US dry quart is equal to 1/32 of a US bushel, exactly 1.101220942715 litres.
name: Quart (US dry)

description: A US liquid quart exactly equals 57.75 cubic inches, which is exactly equal to 0.946352946 litres.
name: Liquid quart (US)

description: Thousand cubic metre
name: Thousand cubic metre

description: Revolutions Per Minute
name: Revolutions Per Minute

description: Metre squared per second.
name: Square Metre / Second

description: A second is a unit of time equal to 1/60th of an minute.
name: Second (unit of time)

description: A unit of count defining the number of sets (set: a number of objects grouped together).
name: Set

description: A statute mile of 5,280 feet (exactly 1,609.344 meters).
name: Mile (statute mile)

description: Number of allergens based on the SQ-E unit
name: SQ-E

description: Ton (US) = 2000 Lb or 907 Kg
name: Ton (US) or short ton (UK)

description: A unit of count defining the number of shipments (shipment: an amount of goods shipped or transported).
name: Shipment

description: Thousand piece
name: Thousand piece

description: Metric ton = 1000 Kg
name: Tonne

description: Teeth Per Inch
name: Teeth Per Inch

description:
A unit of count defining the number of tablets 
(tablet: a small flat or compressed solid object).
name: Tablet

description: Torr
name: Torr

description: Volt
name: Volt

description: A week is a time unit equal to seven days.
name: Week

description: The watt-hour is a unit of energy equivalent to one watt of power expended for one hour of time; it is equal to 3.6 kilojoules.  The watt-hour is rarely used to express energy in any form other than electrical.
name: Watt hour

description: A watt is a derived unit of power; one watt is equivalent to 1 joule (J) of energy per second.
name: Watt

description:
A unit used for quantifying the vitamin A value of sources of vitamin A, including both preformed retinoids and precursor carotenoids.  Examples include: 
. One RE is equivalent to 1 mcg of retinol, 6 mcg of Beta-carotene, or 12 mcg of other pro-vitamin A carotenoids. 
. One RE is equivalent to  0.3 International Units of retinol or 0.1 International Units of Beta-carotene.
name: Retinol Equivalent (RE)

description: A unit of count defining the number of rolls where "Roll" is the name of the code value in UN/ECE Recommendation 21, pluralized as appropriate.
name: Roll

description: A unit of count defining the number of servings being referenced. There is a validation limiting the usage of this UoM.
name: Serving

description: A unit of count defining the number of “Sheets” where “Sheet” is the name of the code value in UN/ECE Recommendation 21, pluralized as appropriate.
name: Sheet

description: A measurement of the number of amps a battery can deliver at 0 ° F for 30 seconds and not drop below 7.2 volts.
name: Cold Cramp Amp

description: Colony Forming Units per gram (CFU/g). See CFU for definition of Colony Forming Unit
name: Colony Forming Units per gram (CFU/g)

description: Colony Forming Units per Pound (CFU/lb) See CFU for definition of Colony Forming Unit
name: Colony Forming Units per Pound (CFU/lb)

description: A count of attenuation steps or dilution levels representing the homeopathic potency of a substance using the Hahnemannian (CH) method of attenuation; commonly denoted as CH1, CH2, CH3, etc. Each centesimal attenuation step represents one part source material combined with 99 parts dilution medium; commonly denoted as C1, C2, C3, etc.
name: Centisimal Hahnemannian Dilution (CH)

description: Decibar
name: Decibar

description: A pennyweight (abbreviated dwt or denarius weight) is a unit of mass that is equal to 24 grains, 1⁄20 of a troy ounce, 1⁄240 of a troy pound, and exactly 1.55517384 grams. (Usage- The pennyweight is the common weight used in the valuation and measurement of precious metals. Jewellers use the pennyweight in calculating the amount and cost of precious metals used in fabricating or casting jewellery. Similarly, dentists and dental labs still use the pennyweight as the measure of precious metals in dental crowns and inlays.)
name: Penny Weight

description: One Hundredth of an inch or 0.01. (Usage- Measurements of Papers, Films, Circuit boards and the like)
name: Hundredths of an Inch

description: International Units per Kilogram (IU/kg) a unit of activity or potency for vitamins, hormones, or other substances, defined individually for each substance in terms of the activity of a standard quantity or preparation.
name: International Units per Kilogram (IU/kg)

description: A count of attenuation steps or dilution levels representing the homeopathic potency of a substance using the Korsakovian (K) method of attenuation; commonly denoted as CK1, CK2, CK3, etc. Each centesimal attenuation step represents one part source material combined with 99 parts dilution medium; commonly denoted as C1, C2, C3, etc.
name: Korsakovian (K)

description: A count of attenuation steps or dilution levels representing the homeopathic potency of a substance where each attenuation step represents one part source material combined with 49,999 parts dilution medium; commonly denoted as LM1, LM2, LM3, etc.
name: Millesimai (LM)

description: Fuel usage by the number of miles the trade item can go on 1 US gallon of fuel.
name: Miles Per Gallon

description: A count of a dry crud medical substance Mother tincture, when used for homeopathic preparations, are liquid preparations obtained by the solvent action of a suitable vehicle upon raw materials.  The raw materials (medical substance) are usually in the fresh form but may be dried.  Mother tinctures for homeopathic preparations may also be obtained from plant juices, with, or without the addition of a vehicle.
name: Mother tincture (Dry material)

description: A nanogram is 10-9 gram or a billionth of a gram.
name: Nanogram

description: A unit of count defining the number of pixels per linear centimetre as a measurement of the resolution of devices in various contexts; typically computer displays, image scanners or digital camera image sensors.
name: Pixel per centimetre

description: A unit of count defining the number of pixels per linear inch (PPI) as a measurement of the resolution of devices in various contexts; typically computer displays, image scanners or digital camera image sensors.
name: Pixel per inch

description: A measure of vitamin A activity based on the capacity of the body to convert provitamin carotenoids containing at least one unsubstituted ionone ring to retinaldehyde. 1 microgram RAE = 1 mg retinol = 12 mg β-carotene = 24 mg other vitamin A precursor carotenoids.
name: Retinol Activity Equivalents

description: Thirty Seconds of an inch (1/32 or 0.3125). (Usage when measuring using some measuring tapes. Commonly used in model making and some hobbies for scaling to full size.  Also used in railway applications.)
name: Thirty Seconds of an Inch

description: A unit of count defining the number of samplings takes during a period of time
name: Sample per second

description: One Ten Thousandths of an inch or 0.0001 often called a "tenth" in machinery. (Usage- Measurements of some machine parts, gaps in spark plugs).
name: Ten Thousandths of an Inch

description: A square yard is the area of a square with sides of one yard (three feet, thirty-six inches, 0.9144 metres) in length
name: Square Yard

description: A yard is It is equal to 3 feet or 36 inches or  0.9144 meter.
name: Yard
